alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 31 at 8:14PM MST until August 31 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 845 PM MST. * At 814 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Florence Junction to Queen Creek to near Sun Lakes to near Maricopa, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 143 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 176 and 213. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 172. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 26 and 55. AZ Route 101 between mile markers 55 and 61. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 31 and 44. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 129 and 150. AZ Route 347 between mile markers 161 and 189. This includes AZ Interstate 10 between 157 and 204. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Casa Grande, Apache Junction, Florence, Coolidge, East Mesa, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Arizona City, and Gold Camp. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
